content:
TITLE: Creating a Bar Chart with React Spectrum Charts
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to create a bar chart using React Spectrum Charts components. It demonstrates the usage of Chart, Axis, Bar, and Legend components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum-charts/blob/main/packages/react-spectrum-charts/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import React from 'react';
import {Axis, Bar, Legend, Chart} from '@adobe/react-spectrum-charts';

const MyChart: FC<MyChartProps> = (props) => {
    ...

    return (
        <Chart data={myChartData}>
            <Axis position="bottom" />
            <Axis position="left" />
            <Bar type="stacked" color="series" />
            <Legend />
        </Chart>
    )
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Basic Chart with React Spectrum Charts
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to create a stacked bar chart using React Spectrum Charts components. The chart includes axes, bar visualization, and a legend.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum-charts/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: ts
CODE:
```
import React from 'react';
import {Axis, Bar, Legend, Chart} from '@adobe/react-spectrum-charts';

const MyChart: FC<MyChartProps> = (props) => {
    ...

    return (
        <Chart data={myChartData}>
            <Axis position="bottom" />
            <Axis position="left" />
            <Bar type="stacked" color="series" />
            <Legend />
        </Chart>
    )
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning and Installing React Spectrum Charts Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands for forking, cloning the repository, and installing dependencies. Requires Node.js v14.15.0+ and Yarn v1.22.0+.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum-charts/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/react-spectrum-charts
cd react-spectrum-charts
yarn install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Tests in React Spectrum Charts
DESCRIPTION: Commands for running tests. Includes options for running tests once or in watch mode for continuous testing during development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum-charts/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn test
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn watch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing React Spectrum Charts with npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install React Spectrum Charts and its dependencies using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum-charts/blob/main/packages/react-spectrum-charts/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @adobe/react-spectrum-charts @adobe/react-spectrum vega vega-lite
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing React Spectrum Charts with npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install React Spectrum Charts and its dependencies using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum-charts/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @adobe/react-spectrum-charts @adobe/react-spectrum vega vega-lite
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Storybook Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run the Storybook development server locally. Opens a browser at http://localhost:6009 for UI component development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum-charts/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn start
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn storybook
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing React Spectrum Charts with yarn
DESCRIPTION: Command to install React Spectrum Charts and its dependencies using yarn package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum-charts/blob/main/packages/react-spectrum-charts/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn add @adobe/react-spectrum-charts @adobe/react-spectrum vega vega-lite
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing React Spectrum Charts with yarn
DESCRIPTION: Command to install React Spectrum Charts and its dependencies using yarn package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum-charts/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn add @adobe/react-spectrum-charts @adobe/react-spectrum vega vega-lite
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: RFC Markdown Template Structure
DESCRIPTION: Structured markdown template that defines the format for submitting RFCs to the React Spectrum Charts project. Includes sections for summary, motivation, detailed design, documentation, drawbacks, compatibility analysis, alternatives, questions, and related discussions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum-charts/blob/main/rfcs/template.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
-   Start Date: (fill me in with today's date, YYYY-MM-DD)
-   RFC PR: (leave this empty, to be filled in later)
-   Authors: (the names of everyone contributing to this RFC)

# (RFC title goes here)

## Summary

<!-- One-paragraph explanation of the feature. -->

## Motivation

<!-- Why are we doing this? What use cases does it support? What is the expected
outcome? -->

## Detailed Design

<!--
   This is the bulk of the RFC.

   Explain the design with enough detail that someone familiar with React-Spectrum
   can implement it by reading this document. Please get into specifics
   of your approach, corner cases, and examples of how the change will be
   used. Be sure to define any new terms in this section.
-->
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running ESLint for Code Quality
DESCRIPTION: Command to run ESLint for checking code quality and enforcing style guidelines in the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum-charts/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-18_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn lint
```
